column5: I tried making tacos, but none seemed to like them.

column2: I once had a grey cat.
column3: Eventually I moved and Hero stayed and it was sad.
column4: The cat was named Hero.
column5: I decided to take Hero with me on the move.

column2: Sara needed a prescription.

column4: Sara walked up to the pharmacy to see if her prescription was ready.
column5: Sara went to the library to talk to the pharmacist.

column2: My wife needed a pair of boots for the winter.
column3: Then she bought four more pairs!
column4: When my wife went to the shoe store she found a deal on boot for me.
column5: When I went to the store I found a deal on boots for me.

column2: Jim is shocked when he gets an amazing deal on a house.

column4: The house is full of moldy cheese.

column2: Jacob was driving home from work.

column5: Jacob stopped to help someone fix a tire.

column2: Today we went on a plane ride.

column5: And there was a fight over the game.

column2: Sadie was excited.

column5: Sadie was thrilled to get a top publishing agency to sign her.

column2: My boss asked me to find the mean value of a data set.

column4: I gave my boss the answer quickly.
column5: My boss gave me the answer quickly.

column2: I decided to clean my chimney.

column4: I opened the flue and a bunch of ash fell out.
column5: I found a birds nest and knocked it down.

column2: Samuel loved reading old science fiction stories.
column3: Samuel could not read.
column4: Samuel forgot his reading glasses.
column5: Samuel forget his reading shovel.

column2: Early Saturday morning as I sat reading my Bible a butterfly flew by.
column3: I watched her until she faded away and then resumed my study.
column4: She moved as though she were dancing through the air.
column5: SATURDAY MORNING AS I WOKE UP EARLY AND READING MY BIBLE ALWAYS.

column2: Joan's grandma had to go to a nursing home.

column4: Joan's grandma is getting very old and she was doing unwanted things in home.
column5: Joan took some jars her grandma couldn't stand anymore.

column2: I entered an egg race once.

column5: Gina finally arrived at home.

column5: Sam was nervous about the bus ride.

column2: Tina has two dogs.
